availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert A. Waller (Union County, Kentucky, resident, law student, and soldier)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, law student and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Aaron Waller and Mary Waller. Attended school in Union County in 1850. Household owned twenty-two enslaved persons in Union County in 1850. Law student in Union County in 1860. Household owned twenty enslaved persons in Union County in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from October 10, 1862, to February 17, 1865. Captured near Atlanta, Fulton County, Georgia, on July 18, 1864. Prisoner of war at Camp Douglas, Cook County, Illinois, from August 1, 1864, to February 17, 1865. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. government on February 17, 1865.
